text: Giulio Giorello (; 14 May 1945 â€“ 15 June 2020) was an Italian philosopher, mathematician, and epistemologist. He was born in Milan. He taught physics and natural sciences at the University of Pavia, University of Catania, University of Insubria and the University of Milan. He was also President of SILFS (Italian Society of Logic and Philosophy of Science). Giorello died in Milan on 15 June 2020 from COVID-19, aged 75. ==References== Category:1945 births Category:2020 deaths Category:People from Milan Category:Italian philosophers Category:Italian mathematicians Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Milan
title: Giulio Giorello
